channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: In Search of a Few Good Rock Stars - Houston, TX
item.description: Perl positions are open at several levels, so whether you???re just starting out with 1-2 years of experience or a seasoned pro with a few decades under your belt, they want to hear from you. Grab a microphone, a megaphone, or shoot us an email, but whatever you do, don???t let this chance to make your mark pass you by.

item.title: Wanted: Junior Perl Developer Ready to Move Up from the Bunny Hill - Kent, UK
item.description: Junior developers???are you eager to leave the bunny hill behind but not quite ready for a double black diamond? Then slip on your ski boots and prepare to slalom, because we have an exciting opportunity for you!

item.title: Paging Dr. Perl! Perl job in Cambridge, UK
item.description: This organization is one of the world???s leading developers of medical diagnostic technologies and clinical software. They believe in security, wellness, and the importance of driving innovation to deliver patient benefit. You won???t be in a white coat, but it???s better than that???your work will be used by the NHS, research labs, and healthcare providers worldwide.

item.title: One is the Loneliest Number
item.description: For nearly 16 years, our client has been helping people in the UK and the US find their perfect flatmate. Think of all the things that are better with two: seesaws, the tango, splitting the bills???need we go on? If you???re a Perl developer who has experience with other languages like Gearman, Memcached, Sphinx, and MySQL, and agree that two heads are better than one, then this might be for you!

item.title: The Garden of Eden? A Perl job in Eden (well, London)!
item.description: 33 acres of landscaped gardens. 45,000 square feet of on-park retail space. More than 10,000 fun, engaging, like-minded people. It is Utopia? The Garden of Eden? No???it???s where your new office is located, but only if you read on!

item.description: August 10-14 2020, Amsterdam, The Netherlands

item.title: The Perl Conference 2020
item.description: June 23-27 2020 Houston, TX

item.title: DC-Baltimore Perlyglot Workshop (DCBPW) 2020
item.description: April 18-19 2020 Baltimore, MD

item.title: Test Automaton Engineer
item.description: Many companies are looking for 'Test Automation Engineers' or 'QA Automation engineers' or just 'Automation engineers'. In this post I tried to give you some insight to what you need in order to become one.

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description:
Great modules released last week;
MetaCPAN weekly report;
StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: BLOG: THE WEEKLY CHALLENGE #050
item.description: Fun with Raku, one more time, thanks to Weekly Challenge.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 50: overlapping ranges and nobel numbers
item.description: Luca used the power of Range class to solve the Merge Intervals. Looks very clean solution.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge: Merge Inrervals and Noble Numbers
item.description: Laurent shared the power of Raku when solving Noble number task.

item.title: PERL WEEKLY CHALLENGE â€“ 050
item.description: Javier didn't use brute force to solve Merge Intervals task. A very clean solution.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge: Week 50
item.description: Jaldhar shared the power of Range class of Raku.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 050: Merge Intervals and Noble Integer
item.description: Choroba nailed the Merge Intervals task thoroughly. You have to checkout his solution to see it yourself.

item.title: Nobly Merged Raku
item.description: Arne shared how to deal with a very large intervals. You will be surprised by the power of Raku.

item.title: RECAP - Perl Weekly Challenge - 050
item.description: Recap of last week challenge. There are plenty of great solutions.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge - 050
item.description: Don't miss the fun and try new challenges every week. For more information, please read FAQ page.

item.title: White labelling strategies
item.description: Domm presented this at German Perl/Raku Workshop 2020.

item.title: Let's talk about Linux
item.description: What do you love the most about Linux and freedom of the software?

item.title: k-Means k-Means-er
item.description: As we take another lap around the k-Means race trace, the Porsche 914-2 and Volvo 142E are still neck and neck. This time we'll try a straight-forward normalisation that linearly scales all values to the range [0,1] and see if they still end up in the same cluster.

item.title: Perl Intro Curriculum
item.description: If we want to attract new people to Perl conferences (and thus Perl), we must make conferences more beginner-friendly.

item.title: Introducing the TPF Community Affairs Team
item.description: The Perl Foundation is supporting the creation of a Community Affairs Team known as the CAT.

item.title: #450 - German Perl/Raku Workshop - 2020
item.description:
Hi there

Last week belonged to German Perl/Raku Workshop - 2020. Luckily there were regular updates on Twitter. Did you notice the change in name? Raku has been added to make it explicit that Perl and Raku both get equal exposure. I am confident we would see flood of event reports by regulars soon.

How can I forget to mention that Curtis Poe who gave keynote presentation through video conferencing about Cor. Well if you don't know what is Cor, then please checkout earlier editiion of PerlWeekly newsletter

Last but not the least, COVID-19, these days everybody is talking about it. Curtis Poe wrote an interesting blog about Coronavirus Fake News. Stay safe and enjoy reading the newsletter
